meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>tear</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to tear</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You start <vocabulary>to tear</vocabulary> the cloth. You don't know if you're supposed to or not. The crowd isn't sure either. You hear kind of a <reading>yah boo</reading> (やぶ) reaction going on, making you unsure if you should continue or stop. Yah! Boo. Yah! Boo!
